learning_outcomes.description: identify insects to Order on sight
use appropriate methods to identify unknown insects
prepare and curate insect specimens for identification and placement in collections
understand how insects and other animals are classified.
apply the taxonomic conventions in using names of insects.
implement time management skills for an extended project
demonstrate an understanding of insect evolution and diversification

assessments.weighting: <dd>20% each quiz is part of 20% overall </dd>
assessments.task_description: A series of quizzes associated with weekly online modules. The quizzes are to be completed online and some have practice (formative) quizzes that can be attempted multiple times.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Completed online via the course website in Learn.UQ
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Insect collection

Task Description:

You need to make and submit a physical or digital insect collection, or a combination of physical and digital collection. The criteria are attached below.


Important: Students are advised to ensure that you have the appropriate permission/permits for wherever you intend to collect.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Physical insect collections are to be handed in during class in intensive week, or posted to UQ with a receipt by the due date and time. Digital collections are to be submitted via the Turnitin link that will appear in the Assessments menu, by the due date and time.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Final exam, to be held during class time of the intensive week.


You must receive a mark of 50% or higher in the final exam to pass the course.


The exam will include specimens that you need to identify to family, genus or species.


You will be required to demonstrate successful use of identification tools, including specific multiple entry and dichotomous keys.


ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE USE (AI)

AI technologies may be used for all assessments in this course but MUST be acknowledged when used in exams.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
17/12/2024 4:00 pm

To be held during tutorial time.
assessments.task_description:
Identify insects to family, genus or species as required.

You will be required to demonstrate successful use of identification tools, including specific multiple entry and dichotomous keys.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit through Turnitin link in the course assessments folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 8(25 Nov - 26 Jan)
learning_activities.topic:
Insect Collection

Students are to make a digital or physical insect collection and identify the insects to the level specified in the instructions. This will require searching for insects at home or on campus, and attending the optional field trip if they want.
learning_activities.topic_description: Insect Collection Students are to make a digital or physical insect collection and identify the insects to the level specified in the instructions. This will require searching for insects at home or on campus, and attending the optional field trip if they want.

learning_activities.topic:
Background and revision

Self directed: Introduction to course

Videos of professionals discussing entomology as it relates to their jobs

Revision of names of insect Orders

Revision of identifying insect Orders by images

Revision of the arthropods

Week 2: Overview of insect diversity and taxonomy

Basic insect anatomy
Classification & Naming
Insect diversity
learning_activities.topic_title: Week 2: Overview of insect diversity and taxonomy
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 2: Overview of insect diversity and taxonomy Basic insect anatomy Classification & Naming Insect diversity

learning_activities.topic:
Practical tutorial: Pinning & setting/photography

demonstration and practice of pinning and setting for insect collection, and photos required for a digital collection. Goddard lab 305 for those who can make it F2F. Session will be recorded for those who cannot make it, but students are encouraged to attend if they have not collected and preserved insects before, or have not taken photographs for identification.
learning_activities.topic_description: Practical tutorial: Pinning & setting/photography demonstration and practice of pinning and setting for insect collection, and photos required for a digital collection. Goddard lab 305 for those who can make it F2F. Session will be recorded for those who cannot make it, but students are encouraged to attend if they have not collected and preserved insects before, or have not taken photographs for identification.

learning_activities.topic:
Optional field trip to Hidden Vale

Optional visit Hidden Vale during the day or camp overnight. An opportunity to collect insects and learn from peers and entomologists. You will need to have or arrange your own food, drinks and transport, and camping gear if staying overnight. See information folder on course website.

See information folder on course website.

learning_activities.topic:
prepare collection

Goddard 305: chance to use microscopes and get advice on pinning/photographing/identification.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 8: Intensive week

Guidance in insect identification and use of keys. Molecular identification-DNA barcoding. Identify slide mounted material.

Identification challenges. Taxon-specific talks.

Face to face for internal enrolments: compulsory attendance Wed-Fri but optional Mon-Tues.

Activities streamed for externally enrolled students.

Work of finalising insect collection.
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 8: Intensive week Guidance in insect identification and use of keys. Molecular identification-DNA barcoding.  Identify slide mounted material. Identification challenges. Taxon-specific talks. Face to face for internal enrolments: compulsory attendance Wed-Fri but optional Mon-Tues. Activities streamed for externally enrolled students. Work of finalising insect collection.
